qas.question: In the last 40 years, how much has worldwide paper consumption risen?

context: <b4_0>Worldwide consumption of paper<b4_0/> has risen by <a0_0><b5_0><b9_0>400%<b9_0/><b5_0/><a0_0/> in the past 40 years leading to increase in deforestation, with <a1_0><b8_0><b10_0>35%<b10_0/><b8_0/><a1_0/> of harvested trees being used for paper manufacture. Most paper companies also <a2_0><b11_0>plant <b6_0>trees<b11_0/><b6_0/><a2_0/> to help regrow forests. <b7_0>Logging of old growth forests<b7_0/> accounts for less than <a3_0><b12_0>10%<b12_0/><a3_0/> of wood pulp, but is one of the most controversial issues.
